comment: Lemma for ~ ist1-5 and similar theorems. If ` A ` is a topological property which implies T_0, such as T_1 or T_2, the property can be "decomposed" into T_0 and a non-T_0 version of property ` A ` (which is defined as stating that the Kolmogorov quotient of the space has property ` A ` ). For example, if ` A ` is T_1, then the theorem states that a space is T_1 iff it is T_0 and its Kolmogorov quotient is T_1 (we call this property R_0). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)
